text: Loretta Young (born Gretchen Young, January 6, 1913 - August 12, 2000) was an American actress. Young was born in Salt Lake City, Utah, and moved to Hollywood, Los Angeles, California when she was three. Her sisters were actresses Polly Ann Young (1908-1997) and Sally Blane (1910-1997). Young won an Academy Award for Best Actress for her role in The Farmer's Daughter. She won three Emmy Awards in the 1950s and a Golden Globe Award in 1986. She was a devout Roman Catholic.Judy Lewis, daughter of Loretta Young and Clark Gable, dies She died of ovarian cancer in Los Angeles. == References == == Other websites == * Category:1913 births Category:2000 deaths Category:American Academy Award winning actors Category:Actors from Los Angeles Category:American child actors Category:American movie actors Category:American Roman Catholics Category:American silent movie actors Category:American television actors Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles Category:Deaths from ovarian cancer Category:Emmy Award winners Category:Golden Globe Award winners Category:Actors from Salt Lake City, Utah
title: Loretta Young
